title: ActiveStorage throws exception when using whitespace as filename, may lead to denial of service of multiple pages

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Hi team, 
I've found an issue on the profile picture upload feature of your asset - https://hackerone.com, which can allow a malicious attacker to perform an application wide denial of service attack.
**Description:**
I was playing with the profile picture upload feature, then i observed that when we change the name of our profile picture to `+` , `%0d%0a` , or  `%20` and then refresh the profile page, it would give an internal server error. Then i observed the same behaviour at everyplace where my profile picture was being reflected for example the programs thanks section, hacktivity section or even the directory section. This leads to site wide Denial of Service that will deny all the users from performing any actions. 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Login and visit edit profile page. 
2. Select a normal profile picture and click `Update Profile` button
3. Intercept this Request and change the filename to `+` by editing the request as shown in  ██████████
4. Turn off the intercept button and the refresh the update page.
5. Notice that it wont load. 
Now the similar behaviour can be observed at every place where your profile picture is shown.  

### Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots)

 * █████

### Optional: Did you use [recon data made available by HackerOne](https://github.com/Hacker0x01/helpful-recon-data) to find this vulnerability?

no

## Impact

Application wide denial of service. The more places where the profile pictures are being shown, the higher the impact for example - hacktivity, program from page, thanks page, etc
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:
Hi team,
I've found an issue on the profile picture upload feature of your asset - https://hackerone.com, which can allow a malicious attacker to perform an application wide denial of service attack.
Description:
I was playing with the profile picture upload feature, then i observed that when we change the name of our profile picture to + , %0d%0a , or %20 and then refresh the profile page, it would give an internal server error. Then i observed the same behaviour at everyplace where my profile picture was being reflected for example the programs thanks section, hacktivity section or even the directory section. This leads to site wide Denial of Service that will deny all the users from performing any actions.

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Login and visit edit profile page.
  2. Select a normal profile picture and click Update Profile button
  3. Intercept this Request and change the filename to + by editing the request as shown in ██████████
  4. Turn off the intercept button and the refresh the update page.
  5. Notice that it wont load. Now the similar behaviour can be observed at every place where your profile picture is shown.

Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots)

  • █████

Optional: Did you use recon data made available by HackerOne to find this vulnerability?

no

Impact

Application wide denial of service. The more places where the profile pictures are being shown, the higher the impact for example - hacktivity, program from page, thanks page, etc

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. 

Although your finding might appear to be a security vulnerability, after reviewing your submission it appears this behavior does not pose a concrete and exploitable risk to the platform, as this only affects yourself. 

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you’ll continue to research, and submit any future security issues you find.

Cheers,
@still
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

Although your finding might appear to be a security vulnerability, after reviewing your submission it appears this behavior does not pose a concrete and exploitable risk to the platform, as this only affects yourself.

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you’ll continue to research, and submit any future security issues you find.

Cheers,
@still

activities.message:
Hi @still, thanks for the response. I am sorry if i didn't explained the vulnerability correctly as i wrote it in a hurry.
Below are the additional details.
---------
##INTRO
First lets understand what exactly happens when we upload a profile picture.As soon as we upload a picture and click update details button the following request is sent - 
```
PUT /settings/profile HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:69.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/69.0
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Referer: https://hackerone.com/settings/profile/edit
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=---------------------------27504750526957
Content-Length: 13560
Connection: close

-----------------------------27504750526957
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="user[profile_picture]"; filename="asdasd.png"
Content-Type: image/png

ÂPNG
...
-----------------------------27504750526957--
```
Which gives a null JSON in response - `{}`.When you'll refresh your profile page , a similar url is loaded to fetch your profile picture. - `https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/asdasd.png`, which in turn redirects to `https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com/variants/zkf2EFxg3V9ThRGd61DoVyqD/cf1e4b5d44005cb61fab358dd6968415f20545de5f055ba4ed33ca4387948cdc`.

##The ATTACK
Now, if we replace the filename to any url character like `+` or `%20`, which is a whitespace and then refresh the profile page, the following url is fetched to get the profile picture `https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representation/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/+` which is equal to -`https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representation/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/`. And if we visit it manually, we get a 404 error.
###How can someone weaponize it?
So when we visit a program's profile page or thanks page, profile of top 5 hackers as well as all the others who have successfully closed a report with that program can be seen respectively. This profile includes their username as well as profile picture.A graphql request is sent to fetch these details. Now suppose a malicious actor have followed the trick mentioned in the ATTACK section and exists in a programs hall of fame or is a one of the top 5 hackers, when the same graphql request is sent to fetch the details, it responds with a 500 error because the profile picture of malicious actor doesn't exists as mentioned above. This leads to a Denial of service.      
##Steps To Reproduce
To reproduce this attack, certain conditions must be met.-
* You exist in a hall of fame of any public program OR are in the top 5 (Which increases the impact as no one would be able to submit a report)
* You have a recently closed a report with a public program(it will DOSes the while hacktivity section)
* OR there is any other place where a users's profile picture is shown/reflected.

###Take the following steps to execute the attack :-
1. Login and visit `edit profile` section
2. Upload any normal image and click `upload profile button`
3. Intercept this request, edit the filename to `+` and then forward the edited request.
4. Now in incognito tab, visit your profile page. Notice that it gives  500 error.(F607324)
5. , visit the thanks page of a program where you exist in their hall of fame.
6. Notice that the page wont load.( Behind the scene at F607317. Notice the 500 errors from the graphql requests)
7. Now if you have recently closed a report with a public program, maybe you wont be able to see the hacktivity section too.(i haven't tested it since i have closed a report recently)

##Impact
So basically this attack will impact any place where the attacker profile picture is being fetched or shown for example - his/her profile page, the program profile page(if the attacker exists in their top 5 list), the hacktivity section(i'm not sure about it since i couldn't test it), the programs thanks tab(again if he/she exists there)
leading to A Denial Of Service Attack.
If you need additional proof, please let me know. :)
Addtionally, i you need live demo, let me know.
Thanks and Regards,
@ninetynine

Below are the additional details.

INTRO

First lets understand what exactly happens when we upload a profile picture.As soon as we upload a picture and click update details button the following request is sent - 

PUT /settings/profile HTTP/1.1

-----------------------------27504750526957

Content-Type: image/png

ÂPNG
...
-----------------------------27504750526957--

Which gives a null JSON in response - {}.When you'll refresh your profile page , a similar url is loaded to fetch your profile picture. - https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/asdasd.png, which in turn redirects to https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com/variants/zkf2EFxg3V9ThRGd61DoVyqD/cf1e4b5d44005cb61fab358dd6968415f20545de5f055ba4ed33ca4387948cdc.

The ATTACK

Now, if we replace the filename to any url character like + or %20, which is a whitespace and then refresh the profile page, the following url is fetched to get the profile picture https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representation/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/+ which is equal to -https://hackerone.com/rails/active_storage/representation/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdytHQ2c9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--afb5586dfeca197425df970ad5404995d72fd7cf/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lOTWpZd2VESTJNRDRHT2daRlZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--046b84087493d0d7ec61d29748cef8b7d4f99dc5/. And if we visit it manually, we get a 404 error.

How can someone weaponize it?

So when we visit a program's profile page or thanks page, profile of top 5 hackers as well as all the others who have successfully closed a report with that program can be seen respectively. This profile includes their username as well as profile picture.A graphql request is sent to fetch these details. Now suppose a malicious actor have followed the trick mentioned in the ATTACK section and exists in a programs hall of fame or is a one of the top 5 hackers, when the same graphql request is sent to fetch the details, it responds with a 500 error because the profile picture of malicious actor doesn't exists as mentioned above. This leads to a Denial of service.

Steps To Reproduce

To reproduce this attack, certain conditions must be met.-

  • You exist in a hall of fame of any public program OR are in the top 5 (Which increases the impact as no one would be able to submit a report)
  • You have a recently closed a report with a public program(it will DOSes the while hacktivity section)
  • OR there is any other place where a users's profile picture is shown/reflected.

Take the following steps to execute the attack :-

  1. Login and visit edit profile section
  2. Upload any normal image and click upload profile button
  3. Intercept this request, edit the filename to + and then forward the edited request.
  4. Now in incognito tab, visit your profile page. Notice that it gives 500 error.(F607324)
  5. , visit the thanks page of a program where you exist in their hall of fame.
  6. Notice that the page wont load.( Behind the scene at POC-2.PNG (F607317). Notice the 500 errors from the graphql requests)
  7. Now if you have recently closed a report with a public program, maybe you wont be able to see the hacktivity section too.(i haven't tested it since i have closed a report recently)

Impact

So basically this attack will impact any place where the attacker profile picture is being fetched or shown for example - his/her profile page, the program profile page(if the attacker exists in their top 5 list), the hacktivity section(i'm not sure about it since i couldn't test it), the programs thanks tab(again if he/she exists there)
leading to A Denial Of Service Attack.
If you need additional proof, please let me know. :)
Addtionally, i you need live demo, let me know.
Thanks and Regards,
@ninetynine

activities.message:
Hey there, 
I have another scenario which would completely DOS the Directory section of hackerone.
###Scenario:-
Lets us consider that a malicious actor have recently launched a public program on  hackerone. His program is will be visible on https://hackerone/directory. Now to completely poison the directory, he upload a profile picture  with filename as -`+` like i've mentioned above. Now when visits, https://hackerone.com/directory, the page won't load as the graphql query will result in a '500' error. That because it will try to fetch the profile picture of the malicious actors program, but it doesn't exist since `+` is equal to a whitespace for URL.
No one will be able to access the directory page if anyone performs this attack!
Please fix it...
Thank you
@ninetynine
activities.markdown_message:

That because it will try to fetch the profile picture of the malicious actors program, but it doesn't exist since + is equal to a whitespace for URL.
No one will be able to access the directory page if anyone performs this attack!
Please fix it...
Thank you
@ninetynine

activities.message:
Hi,
I had reported an issue to hackerone (#713407), which was closed as N/A maybe because I was not able to provide in-depth details about the vulnerability. Later I added more information but no one has replied on it even after 11 days. I am pretty confident that it is a valid vulnerability which can cause some serious impact.
I know that Hackerone's average resolution time is about 1 month but the triagers can at least reply whether they have acknowledged my report or if additional details are required
Please help me out.

Thank you,
@ninetynine
